text: I'm going for God hi everyone Anthony
Fantan oh here the Internet's busiest
music nerd and it's time for a review of
the new bats album obsidian bats is the
pseudonym of will weeson Feld he is a
songwriter singer producer and his music
made a relatively big splash back in
2010 through the full-length LP cerulean
out on anti Cohn records a very
colourful album loaded with beats that
are very compressed wonky as well as
glitchy and take a ton of influence from
pop music as well as hip hop music it
was a sound that was really popular
during that year but has waned a little
bit in buzz since then they're actually
quite a few records that year they had a
pretty buzzy glitch hop vibe to them
people like toki monsta Teebs as well as
no such thing had notable releases
however on this new LP bats does not go
back to his old ways to his old sound on
his last full-length debut instead this
new LP goes in a direction that brings
together indie electronic music glitch
pop and occasionally will tones the
electronics down and wraps these songs
and piano and strings much more acoustic
instrumentation and most importantly he
really comes through on this album and
flexes those singer-songwriter muscles
writing songs that not only have a lot
of lyrics and his vocals right up front
and center but verses and choruses so
without question on obsidian wills vocal
delivery and vocal personality plays a
much larger role while this album is not
as psychedelic or as otherworldly or
maybe even as strange or as novel as
cerulean bats does keep the sound play
and some of the experimentation up there
are lots of odd speedy almost
unpredictable and glitchy pieces of
percussion that pop up in nearly
unpredictable places throughout many of
these beats however if there is a
downside to some of the percussion right
off the bat on this LP it is not as
heavy bass or
fefe as some of the percussion on
cerulean it definitely pales in
comparison in terms of just resonances
still there is detail on these more
subtle beats that bats pulls together
like on the track incompatible which has
a very very dense complex rhythm to it
it is a difficult beat it's a difficult
groove and with the piano the strings
and the acoustic guitar leading to this
track there's a serious sense of I guess
you could say wonderment it's got a bit
of an old-world feel to it in a way I'm
thinking like trees streams rocks
animals sort of dancing by medieval
castles magic sorcery the dark arts
whether a track on here seems to
emphasize acoustic instrumentation over
electronic or vice-versa
the production chops that Baths
showcased on cerulean are still there
they just show up in different ways if
there is an issue that's keeping me from
loving this LP though that I have to
admit it's that I'm not as thrilled with
will as a songwriter or really a singer
for one wills voice to my ears is
effeminately sharp with its tone and
it's it's so much so that feel sort of
zany to me at times not only that but
wills vocals are mixed so high above a
lot of the other electronics on these
songs that it really overpowers some of
the beats on this thing making it
difficult to appreciate these songs for
the good production that's in the
background and there are tracks on here
where the instrumentals do get so simple
and straightforward that there isn't
much else to observe but the vocals and
the songwriting that bat's is trying to
pull together like the song no eyes
which features a kind of slow kick snare
pattern that kind of reminds me of Nine
Inch Nails track closer and like that
track this one has a particular
obsession with sex sex is kind of a fix
in this song I mean the chorus pretty
much is common that me the track is
pretty much a poppy observation of the
seperation between love and physical
relations which is a fine subject matter
to write a song about I just find too
ever so slightly obnoxious kind of
annoying
typically wills vocals appeared on his
previous material as an additional sound
or just something that was adding a
little extra color in my opinion added
an edge to a lot of his songs even
though at the time they were kind of
off-the-wall still I do appreciate that
there's a little bit of a theatrical
element going on here something that
feels sort of Antony in the johnsons or
even Bjork inspired at times when bats
really loses me on this LP it's when
there is really no wonderment or much of
anything interesting in the instrumental
whatsoever really it's bats not doing
glitch hop or even doing glitch pop but
instead just making middle-of-the-road
in the electronic music that reminds me
of like dental like the song miasma sky
however there are some bright spots
there are some moments there are some
highlights that I do dig on this LP like
we saw Iron Works which in my opinion is
so beautifully arranged and covered in
extra instrumentation most notably the
strings it's so well arranged it's
impossible to deny and the song Accio
airy the vocals on this track are toned
down a little bit to a point where I can
really not only tolerate them but enjoy
them and the slow pace of the beat on
this thing with the driving bass line
kind of reminds me of like a 90's
trip-hop tune and surprisingly I really
like the dark murky wall of
instrumentation on the song no past and
the throbbing beat on this thing it's a
little tortured the interjecting piano
phrases that totally break the vibe of
the song and transition back into it
quickly are pretty interesting as well
you'd think they would stick out and
sort of ruin the flow of the track but
they sort of enhanced how eccentric bats
can be when he puts his mind to it
overall this is a pretty decent mixed
bag of tracks paths has really used this
album in my opinion as kind of a
training ground of firing range
test for his singing songwriting chops
as opposed to what we already know he
can do as a producer and there are some
hits there are some misses and there are
songs that really sort of breeze by me
and don't stick with me in any way shape
or form
I feel delight to decent six on this
thing if you've given it a listen what
did you think of it did you love it
hate it why what do you think I should
review next and that's it this review is
my opinion if you don't like it
here's a straw I want to give a shout
out to Germaine Carrie Jackie vine and
cuts on your thumb
only the strong subscribe all mistakes
were intentional Anthony Fantana batts
obsidian forever
[Music]
[Music]
